faqs.question: Czy obcokrajowcy mogą kupić nieruchomość w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain without restrictions. Non-residents simply need an NIE (Spanish tax identification number), obtainable through local authorities. Most international buyers work with Spanish lawyers specializing in property transactions to ensure smooth processes. The legal framework is transparent and well-established for foreign ownership.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty życia na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living is significantly lower than the UK or most Northern European countries. Dining out costs €10-20 per person, fresh market produce is inexpensive, and utilities average €80-120 monthly. Private healthcare costs roughly 40% less than private UK insurance. This affordability extends your holiday home budget while maintaining excellent quality of life.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty zakupu nieruchomości w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Beyond the property price, expect: transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), notary fees (€800-1,500), property registration fees (€300-600), and legal fees (€1,000-2,000). Total closing costs typically range 8-12% of purchase price. No stamp duty or transaction fees apply beyond those listed. Professional guidance ensures transparent costing.

faqs.question: Czy mogę uzyskać kredyt hipoteczny w Hiszpanii jako obcokrajowiec?
faqs.answer: Yes, many Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreign buyers, typically up to 70% of property value with 15-30 year terms. Interest rates are currently competitive. British expats often use Spanish mortgages, though some prefer UK mortgage lenders. Proof of income, credit history, and identification are standard requirements. Working with a Spanish mortgage broker simplifies the process.

faqs.question: Jak daleko jest Costa Blanca od Polski?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport is 40 minutes from this property, with direct flights to London (2 hours flight time) and other UK cities. Budget airlines offer competitive fares, making regular visits from the UK feasible. Ferry alternatives from Portsmouth to Cherbourg provide road-trip options for those preferring slower travel.

faqs.question: Jaka jest pogoda na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Exceptional. Over 320 days of sunshine annually with mild winters (15-17°C average) and warm summers (28-30°C). The Mediterranean climate eliminates frost and heavy rain, supporting year-round outdoor living. Spring and autumn provide perfect beach weather, while summers suit water sports and evening activities when temperatures moderate.

faqs.question: Czy Costa Blanca jest dobra dla emerytów?
faqs.answer: Excellent. The healthcare system is accessible with English-speaking doctors, cost of living is low, and the climate supports active lifestyles. The established expat community offers social networks and familiar services. Many retirees combine personal residence with holiday rental income, creating engaging retirement lifestyles with financial benefits.
